intro: Corallocarpus schinzii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has a short, thick stem with fleshy, waxy leaves that are typically heart-shaped. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Corallocarpus schinzii is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
